Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) | WormClassroom

[img_assist nid=301 title= desc= link=node align=none width=400 height=313]

This is a C. elegans embryo (surrounded by other embryos) at the 2-cell stage (the two big gray spots are its two nuclei). The magnification is about 5,000X. Click on the image to view its bigger image (~ 900K).

{width=”200” height=”200”}

(TEM Flash movie, 550K, movie length: 16”)

TEM images by Jay Campbell, Laboratory for Optical and Computational Instrumentation (LOCI).
